page.title: 05FISHING IN THE HUMBER
page.content: { FISHING}At Skeffling fishermen put their nets out onto the mudflats of the River Humber known as Spurn Bight { METHOD}The nets are placed about half a mile out in the river at low tide. They are about eight metres long with buoys or floats tied to them. The fishermen put down nets and wait for the tide to come back in and with it the fish. Then the fish swim into the net and get stuck. When the tide goes out again the fishermen can go back and bring in the nets and fish.Then they wash the fish in the nearby drain,put them into boxes and take them home. { FISH CAUGHT}The kinds of fish they catch are plaice,eels,flatfish and some shellfish.
